workout_title: Beginner Chest, Shoulder, and Triceps Blast

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind your back and gently pull your arms back, stretching your chest. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, letting your hand fall behind your head. Gently pull your elbow with your other hand. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Perform for 1 minute.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is comfortably supported.  Grab the handles, ensuring a firm grip. Position yourself so that your arms are slightly wider than shoulder-width apart when you begin the exercise.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back firmly against the backrest. Grab the handles, ensuring a firm grip. Your arms should be slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Lower the Handles: Slowly lower the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.  Inhale as you lower the handles.
3. Press the Handles: Extend your arms to push the handles back to the starting position. Exhale as you press the handles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart with an overhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart with an overhand grip. Your arms should be fully extended but not locked.
2. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent. Inhale as you lower the barbell.
3. Press the Barbell: Extend your arms to press the barbell back to the starting position. Exhale as you press the barbell.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid bouncing the weight or using momentum to complete the reps. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline position (around 30-45 degrees). Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring a firm grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring a firm grip. Your arms should be fully extended but not locked.
2. Lower the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent. Inhale as you lower the dumbbells.
3. Press the Dumbbells: Extend your arms to press the dumbbells back to the starting position. Exhale as you press the dumbbells.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a height that allows you to sit comfortably. Attach a D-handle or rope to the cable.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit on the cable machine with your back straight. Grab the handles, ensuring a firm grip. Your arms should be slightly bent.
2. Bring Handles Together: Slowly bring the handles together in front of you, squeezing your chest muscles. Exhale as you bring the handles together.
3. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, maintaining tension on the muscles. Inhale as you return to the starting position.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly closer than shoulder-width apart. Your hands should be facing each other.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly closer than shoulder-width apart. Your arms should be fully extended but not locked.
2. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Inhale as you lower the barbell.
3. Press the Barbell: Extend your arms to press the barbell back to the starting position. Exhale as you press the barbell.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's low pulley. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the straight bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms downwards, keeping your elbows close to your body. Exhale as you extend your arms.
3. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return your forearms to the starting position, maintaining tension on the muscles. Inhale as you return to the starting position.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms fully extended overhead, holding the bar attachment with an overhand grip.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows. Inhale as you lower the bar.
3. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms back to the starting position by straightening your elbows. Exhale as you extend your arms.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart. Your arms should be fully extended but not locked.
2. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows close to your head. Inhale as you lower the barbell.
3. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms back to the starting position by straightening your elbows. Exhale as you extend your arms.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper chest with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper chest with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. Press the Barbell: Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended. Exhale as you press the barbell.
3. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, maintaining control. Inhale as you lower the barbell.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled movement.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. The last 2-3 reps should feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability.
